newsitem.title: DUBAI: Saudi setting up fertiliser joint venture - paper.
newsitem.headline: Saudi setting up fertiliser joint venture - paper.

text.p: Saudi Arabia is setting up a joint venture fertiliser company to produce ammonia, the Saudi English-language Saudi Gazette said on Monday.

It said the venture, United Fertiliser Company, is being formed by Saudi Arabian Fertiliser Co (SAFCO), National Chemical Fertiliser Company (Ibn Baytar), Arabian Petrochemical Company (Petrokemya) and National Industrial Gases Company (GAS).
It said the new venture will have initial investments of 375 million riyals ($100 million) and will mainly produce ammonia.
Three of the petrochemical companies are affiliates of Saudi industrial giant Saudi Basic Industries Corp. Petrokemya is wholly owned by SABIC.
